p: While results of evidence-based research studies are expected to accumulate in the coming weeks and months, physicians confronting COVID-19 are now offered practice recommendations based on uncontrolled case series and expert opinion. In the absence of the long-term prospective studies, hypotheses are generated to launch cohort studies and trials on prevention and treatment of COVID-19. Some of these hypotheses may lack justification and pose ethical challenges. The interpretation of such hypotheses needs to be done through the prism of research reporting standards. 16
